sorular.soru: What is the statutory speed limit in built-up areas?

feedback.metin: The statutory speed limit within built-up areas is 50 km/h, unless otherwise indicated, for example by a 30 km/h speed limit sign or an erf sign. A higher speed limit may also apply locally, for example 70 km/h. This is also indicated by signs. If there are no signs present, the speed limit is 50 km/h.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum length of a passenger car including load?

feedback.metin: The maximum length of a passenger car is 12 metres. This includes cargo and load carriers.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum construction speed of a vehicle with this number plate?

feedback.metin: This number plate belongs to a moped with a maximum construction speed of 45 km/h. The number plate of a snorfiets, in other words a moped with a maximum construction speed of 25 km/h, is blue.
